definition: hiding a sickness for fear of treatment (idiom); fig. concealing a fault to avoid criticism/to keep one's shortcomings secret/to refuse to listen to advice
to avoid mentioning/taboo word/name of deceased emperor or superior
to be jealous of/fear/dread/scruple/to avoid or abstain from/to quit/to give up sth

sentences.english: Illness of children or your personal health may need some medical attention.
sentences.chinese: 子女或你自己的健康狀況不佳，不要諱疾忌醫。

sentences.english: People are not afraid of illness, fear or no fear cure.
sentences.chinese: 人不怕生病，就怕諱疾忌醫或無藥可治。

sentences.english: Men are notoriously bad at seeking medical help, and even more so for sexual problems.
sentences.chinese: 男人以諱疾忌醫著稱，在性方面的問題上尤甚。

definition: lit. to turn to any doctor one can find when critically ill (idiom); fig. to try anyone or anything in a crisis
it will cause no end of trouble (idiom)
variant of 小題大做|小题大做[xiao3 ti2 da4 zuo4]
virtue has its rewards (idiom); one good turn deserves another
vocal accompaniment in some traditional Chinese operas/to speak in support of/to chime in
